title: Russia claims it's successfully tested nuclear-capable weapon | ABC NEWS
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin says his armed forces have successfully tested a nuclear-powered Burevestnik cruise missile, a nuclear-capable weapon the Kremlin claims can evade any defence system. He was speaking with generals overseeing the war in Ukraine. Russia has stepped up its attacks on its smaller neighbour, and has launched more than 1,200 drones across the country in the past week, including on the capital Kyiv. title: Trump heads to Japan after inking deals with ASEAN nations | ABC NEWS
description: US President Donald Trump is headed to Japan after signing a swathe of trade deals with South East Asian nations at the ASEAN summit.  The agreements will allow these countries to keep US tariffs on their exports at the current rates in exchange for buying more US products including Boeing planes.  The US leader also witnessed the official signing ceremony of a Thailand-Cambodia peace treaty alongside Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim in Kuala Lumpur.  Mr Trump is scheduled to meet with newly-appointed Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi before attending the APEC Summit in South Korea.  Meanwhile, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Chinese Deputy Premier He Lifeng have agreed to a framework for anticipated trade talks between President Trump and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping. title: Hurricane Melissa barrels toward Jamaica as Category 4 storm | ABC NEWS
description: Hurricane Melissa has strengthened into a Category 4 storm as it crosses the Caribbean, with Jamaica bracing for unprecedented levels of rain and sustained winds to 220km/h. Jamie Rhome, the deputy director of the Hurricane Centre, is urging residents and tourists to prepare for evacuations amid the potential for 'life-threatening flooding.' title: Barriers to participation in Canberra sport risk leaving players on the sidelines | ABC NEWS
description: Jamie Wolf-Larsen lives with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy (DMD), a rare progressive disease.  Four years ago, Jamie became a full-time power wheelchair user, representing Canberra on the national stage.  But like many community sporting clubs in Canberra, his team faces challenges with player recruitment and participation costs.  An ACT Legislative Assembly inquiry looking into barriers and opportunities in local sport has found some clubs are finding it difficult to survive. title: Egyptian excavators enter Gaza to find Israeli hostage bodies | ABC NEWS
description: Israeli authorities have allowed an Egyptian excavation team to enter Gaza through the Rafah border crossing to find the bodies of deceased Israeli hostages.  The team will work with Red Cross to locate the remains under rubble and will operate inside Israel’s yellow line. Israel is accusing Hamas of deliberately delaying the return of hostage bodies. The Israel-Hamas ceasefire appears to be holding despite several Israeli strikes on targets deemed to be threats to Israeli security. Meanwhile, Israeli media is describing US officials’ consistent visits to Israel as ‘Bibi-sitting’, suggesting Washington is actively deterring the Israeli Prime Minister from reigniting the Gaza war. The Israeli leader has rejected the suggestion.  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Suspected tornado topples trees and sends construction unit flying in Melbourne's west | ABC NEWS
description: It is believed a tornado hit Melbourne's west, causing flying debris, toppling trees and damaging buildings in Werribee and Wyndham Vale. Senior Meteorologist Miriam Bradbury from BOM says there was still some analysis needed to be done, but all signs point to a tornado. title: ACCC sues over Microsoft 365 subscription hikes | ABC NEWS
description: The consumer watchdog is suing Microsoft for allegedly misleading around 2.7 million Australians about their Microsoft 365 subscriptions.  The ACCC claims that Microsoft told subscribers they must sign up for Copilot to renew their subscriptions, leading to a 45% price increase from $109 to $159 per year. title: Predators target children in Australian childcare centres | ABC NEWS
description: A Four Corners investigation has found paedophiles have infiltrated Australia's childcare industry by using the dark web to find each other, share strategies and to justify their actions. The program has found encrypted platforms and messaging services have allowed child sex offenders to congregate in their millions. Experts want a full overhaul of the system to close gaps, including better supervision. Four Corners airs Mondays at 8:30pm on ABC TV and ABC iview. title: Independent left-wing candidate Catherine Connolly wins Irish presidency in landslide | ABC NEWS
description: Catherine Connolly, a veteran lawmaker on the far left of the Irish political spectrum, was elected president by a landslide margin in a stinging rebuke to the recently re-elected centre-right coalition. description: Brisbane is cleaning up after a powerful storm knocked out power to tens of thousands of homes and brought down trees. Hailstones larger than golf balls and wind gusts of nearly 100 kilometres per hour were recorded after a severe thunderstorm tore through south-east Queensland. title: After a violent assault, this small act helped Sissy feel safe | ABC News
description: When Sissy Austin, a young aboriginal woman, was left dizzied and bloodied after an assault while she was running near Ballarat, her sense of safety was shattered. A small act by an attending paramedic helped her feel safe. Now, Ambulance Victoria is using that lesson to drive a slight, but significant change in how paramedics treat patients across Victoria. title: This is what a modern day gold rush looks like #abcnewsshorts
description: Thousands of people have been queueing up at gold selling sites such as ABC Bullion and the Perth Mint to buy gold over the past month. Some people have queued up for hours in Sydney's heat to buy the precious metal, which recently passed $US4,300 an ounce. Analysts say it's related to so-called safe haven demand, as people are worried about global tensions and the economy. Gold holds its value, or at least it has done in the past, so it's seen as a bit of a bunker in case a financial meltdown hits.  #ABCBusiness  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Government confirms no copyright exemption for AI companies | ABC NEWS
description: The government has ruled out a copyright exemption for AI companies using Australian creative works for training. However, some artists and authors say the move has come too late and their intellectual property has already been mined to teach machine learning models.  A working group will meet in the next two days to consider potential updates to existing copyright laws. title: Two words to watch in the rare earths deal | Kohler Shorts | ABC NEWS
description: Australia's mining industry has hailed the landmark rare earths deal the prime minister clinched with US President Donald Trump as a game-changer. The $13 billion deal will accelerate local production of critical minerals, which are nearly entirely processed in China, but as Alan Kohler explains, there are two words in the agreement that hint at more costs to come.
